title: The Divine, Diverse and Vibrant India (Deepak Nangla)
text: By Deepak Nangla Aug 12, 2015 India has continued to attract travelers from all over the world to visit the country and tour its incredible landscapes, rich cultural background, relics of ancient times and to cherish its impressive hospitality and warmth of the local people.A holiday to India is more like a beginning of a journey. Traveling from one end of the country to the other will offer you countless adventures and magic moments. Here lies the beauty of this beautiful Asian nation for which tourists take Flights to India to explore its attractions."If there is one place on the face of earth where all the dreams of living men have found a home from the very earliest days when man began the dream of existence, it is India."-- Romain RollandFrom Kashmir at the top to Kerala at the bottom, from the majestic Himalayas in the north to sandy beaches in the south, from historical monuments to wildlife parks and verdant plantations, India offers the right combination for a perfect vacation.Here's a list of a few experiences that will give you the real feel of India and will also educate you about its distinct appeal. The Captivating Taj Listed in the New Seven Wonders of the World, the Taj Mahal stands as a major tourist attraction in India. No matter how much you have heard about its grandeur or have seen it in pictures, there is no better feeling than seeing its magnificence with your own eyes. The structure looks absolutely divine with its white marble shining against the clear blue sky. The Majestic Himalayas These rugged mountains speak of beauty like no other. There are a number of hill stations scattered all over the Himalayas that bring you closer to nature and offer amazing sights. The meandering rivers, cascading waterfalls, lush meadows, rich flora and fauna and frozen lakes are the other features of its pristine beauty and splendor.Nainital, Darjeeling, Sikkim, Gulmarg, Auli, Manali are a few of its hill stations which are also a playground for adventure sports such as skiing, trekking, rock climbing, mountain biking, paragliding and heli skiing. The Royal Bengal Tiger Nearly 40 national parks in the country are home to this majestic creature. The Jim Corbett National Park, Sunderbans, Ranthambore National Park, Bandhavgarh National Park and Kanha Tiger Reserve are a few places where you can spot the tigers and enjoy the best wildlife sightings. Festivals In a country so rich is customs and tradition, the festivals are a beautiful sight to behold and a different experience altogether. Vibrant, colourful and diverse, these festivals are a prime contributor to India's image in the world as a culturally rich nation. The Kumbh Mela, Ganesh Festival, Diwali, Dussehra, the Goa Carnival, Ladakh Festival, Rath Yatra and the Snake Boat Festival are a few amazing offerings to global tourists.
